quote: I spend most of my day context-switching between tasks. The hardest part is getting back into flow after a meeting.
Documentation is always the last thing I do, and honestly, it often gets skipped. There's never enough time.
I need visibility into what the team is working on without having to interrupt them constantly.
The biggest gap is between what stakeholders want and what's technically feasible. I'm always translating.
Users tell me one thing in interviews but do something completely different in usability tests.
I wish developers understood why I iterate so much on designs. It's not indecision, it's refinement.
Most of my time goes into cleaning data, not analysing it. It's frustrating but necessary.
I struggle to explain my models to non-technical stakeholders. They just want a number, but it's more nuanced.
When something breaks at 3am, I'm the one who gets the call. Burnout is real in this role.
Infrastructure as code has been a game-changer, but the learning curve was steep.
